intro: Ornithopus celtibericus, commonly known as the Celtiberian bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in early summer. Its seed pods are elongated and curved, giving the plant its common name. Ornithopus celtibericus is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
